communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Danyel A. Oliveras on February 12, 2025, at approximately 11:07 AM, by the Hillsborough County Sheriff’s Office. The arrest occurred at or near 1508 Diehl Dr., Hillsborough County, Florida.

According to public records, Oliveras was charged with the following offenses:

Eight counts of Possession of Child Pornography – Florida Statute CHAB0001

One count of In-State Transmission of Child Pornography via Electronic Device – Florida Statute LEWD6070A

One count of Transmission of Harmful Material to Minor – Florida Statute LEWD5080

One count of Unlawful Use of Two-Way Communications Device – Florida Statute MISC1354
Bond for each offense: $2,500

I am specifically requesting:

The full incident and arrest reports, including investigative summaries, detective narratives, and charging documents

Any available digital forensic reports, electronic evidence logs, or device search warrants

Body-worn camera (BWC) footage, if applicable, from the arrest or investigation

Photographs or digital evidence related to the case

CAD logs, dispatch records, or any communications between deputies and the subject

Documentation submitted to the State Attorney’s Office

Due to the serious nature of the charges involving electronic transmission of child exploitation materials, this request is made in the public interest to better understand the investigation and procedures surrounding these offenses.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Akos Emil Lacza on March 29, 2025, at approximately 12:00 AM, by the Charlotte County Sheriff’s Office (Agency Code: CCSO-FL0080000), in the area of Loveland Blvd / Peachland Blvd, Charlotte County, Florida.

According to public records, Lacza was arrested on the following charges:

Fleeing or Attempting to Elude Law Enforcement – Bond: $2,500

Possession or Use of Drug Paraphernalia – Bond: $500

Possession of a Controlled Substance Without a Prescription – Bond: $2,500
Total Bond: $5,500

I am specifically requesting:

The full arrest and incident reports, including officer narratives, probable cause affidavits, and supplemental materials

Any body-worn camera (BWC) footage from deputies involved in the traffic stop or arrest

Any available dash camera footage

911 call recordings and dispatch/CAD logs

Photos, evidence reports, or digital media related to the stop, search, or arrest

This request is submitted in the interest of transparency regarding traffic stops and drug-related arrests, and to better understand law enforcement procedures in such encounters.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Xavier Cruz Velazquez on March 6, 2024, at approximately 9:29 PM, by the Leesburg Police Department in Leesburg, Florida.

According to public records, Velazquez was arrested and charged with the following:

Four counts of Sexual Battery by an Adult on a Child Under 12 Years Old Causing Injury

Florida Statute 794.011(2)(a) — Capital felony

Specifically, I am requesting:

The full arrest and incident reports, including investigative summaries and supporting documents

Any body-worn camera (BWC) footage from responding officers

911 call recordings and transcripts

Any interviews, forensic reports, digital or physical evidence logs

Any CAD logs, dispatch records, or scene photographs

Any documentation submitted to the State Attorney’s Office regarding these charges

Given the gravity and nature of these charges, this request is submitted in the public interest to ensure transparency in how such serious criminal allegations are documented and handled by law enforcement.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Jonathan Michael Daria on March 29, 2025, at approximately 7:14 PM, by the Lake County Sheriff’s Office in Paisley, Florida.

According to public records, Daria was arrested and charged with:

Domestic Battery by Strangulation – Florida Statute 784.041(2)(a), a third-degree felony

Specifically, I am seeking:

The complete arrest and incident reports, including officer narratives, witness/victim statements, and supplemental documentation

Any available body-worn camera (BWC) footage from responding deputies

911 call audio and transcripts

Any photos, video evidence, or CAD/dispatch records

Documentation related to injuries, medical response, or use of force

Due to the serious nature of the charge, this request is made in the interest of public oversight and law enforcement accountability in domestic violence investigations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

Thomas Jackson

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Jeremy William Krenz on October 25, 2024, at approximately 8:11 AM, by the Cripple Creek Police Department in Cripple Creek, Colorado.

According to public records, Krenz was charged with the following offenses:

Second-Degree Burglary

Criminal Attempt – Shoplifting [NCIC Code: 2303]
Bond: $2,500

I am specifically requesting:

The full incident and arrest reports, including officer narratives, supplemental statements, and evidence inventories

Any body-worn camera (BWC) footage from responding officers

Any surveillance footage or third-party video associated with the alleged burglary/shoplifting attempt

Any 911 call recordings and dispatch/CAD logs

Any booking records, mugshots, or property receipts related to this arrest

This request is made in the interest of public transparency and accountability concerning property-related crimes and law enforcement response procedures.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Kaeley Ann-Michelle Lovato on February 2, 2024, at approximately 12:00 AM, by the Eagle Police Department in Eagle, Colorado.

According to public records, Lovato was arrested on the following charges:

Domestic Violence – CRS § 18-6-800.3

Assault in the 3rd Degree – Knowing/Reckless Injury – CRS § 18-3-204(1)(a)

Child Abuse – Negligence (No Injury) – CRS § 18-6-401(1),(7)(b)(I)

Disorderly Conduct – Fighting in Public – CRS § 18-9-106(1)(d)

I am specifically requesting:

The full incident and arrest reports, including officer narratives and any supplemental documentation

Any body-worn camera (BWC) footage recorded by responding officers

Any 911 call audio and transcripts

Any photos, videos, or digital evidence collected

Any CAD logs or dispatch records related to this incident

Given the nature of the charges—particularly those involving child welfare and domestic violence—this request is made in the public interest to better understand law enforcement response and documentation of such incidents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

To Whom It May Concern:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Rachel Harriet Ridley on July 15, 2024, at approximately 12:00 AM, by the Avon Police Department in Colorado.

According to public records, Ridley was arrested on the following charges:

Assault in the Second Degree – Peace Officer (Statute 18-3-203(1)(c)) – Felony

Theft (Statute 18-4-401(1),(5)) – Misdemeanor

Criminal Mischief (Statute 18-4-501(1)) – Felony

Resisting Arrest (Statute 18-8-103) – Misdemeanor

I am specifically requesting:

The full incident and arrest reports, including officer narratives and supplemental documentation

Any body-worn camera (BWC) footage from officers involved in the incident and arrest

Any 911 call recordings or dispatch (CAD) logs related to the event

Any photos, videos, or evidence collected during the investigation

Any documentation regarding injuries to officers, use of force, or medical evaluations

This request is submitted in the interest of transparency, particularly in cases involving alleged assault on law enforcement and resistance during arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Valerie Sanchez Battery Arrest – Nov 5, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Valerie Sanchez on November 5, 2024, at or near 100 SE Prima Vista Blvd, Port St. Lucie, FL, in connection with a battery incident.

Specifically, I am seeking:

All body-worn camera footage from responding deputies (including D/S Gilkey #240, D/S Bailey #2393, and D/S Walker #254)

Any available surveillance footage from the store

The full 911 call audio and transcript

All incident and arrest reports, officer narratives, and witness statements

Any photographs or video evidence collected

This request concerns a public altercation and is made in the interest of transparency in law enforcement response and documentation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

title: November 5, 2024 DUI Arrest of Alexander Finkelstein – St. Lucie County BWC Footage and Reportsc

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: November 5, 2024 DUI Arrest of Alexander Finkelstein – St. Lucie County BWC Footage and Reportsc
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to a DUI arrest that occurred on November 5, 2024, involving Alexander Finkelstein, conducted by Deputy Christian Swierkowski (Badge #2431) of the St. Lucie County Sheriff’s Office.

The incident began with a traffic stop at or near 2501 Orange Avenue, Fort Pierce, Florida, and involved the investigation of suspected impaired driving. The arrest affidavit indicates the availability of body-worn camera footage, as well as photographs taken during the stop and documentation related to a DUI citation (#A16BDAE).

Specifically, I am requesting:

All body-worn camera (BWC) footage from any responding deputies

The full arrest and incident reports, including any officer narratives

Photographs or images submitted as part of the evidence

The DUI citation

Any associated evidence logs or supplemental materials

This request is made in the interest of public transparency and to better understand law enforcement procedures during DUI investigations. The incident appears to have been handled without resistance or escalation, making it an appropriate candidate for public review of standard operating procedure involving BWC documentation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

title: November 11, 2024 Claremont Avenue Shoplifting – Body-Worn Camera Footage and Incident Report

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: November 11, 2024 Claremont Avenue Shoplifting – Body-Worn Camera Footage and Incident Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the police report, any supplemental narratives, and all available body-worn camera (BWC) footage related to a shoplifting incident that occurred on or about November 11, 2024, at the CVS on Claremont Avenue in Montclair, New Jersey.

Based on publicly available reports, the incident involved a 47-year-old male from Staten Island, NY, who was charged at the scene.

If redactions are necessary, I request the release of all reasonably segregable non-exempt portions of the responsive records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson
